```{r}
# Load necessary libraries
library(readxl)
library(ggplot2)

# Load the Excel files with correct parameters
Table_S4 <- read_excel("C:/Users/jacob/OneDrive/Desktop/R Studio Projects 2024/Datasets/Table S4.xlsx", sheet = "Sheet1", skip = 1)
Table_S5 <- read_excel("C:/Users/jacob/OneDrive/Desktop/R Studio Projects 2024/Datasets/Table_S5.xlsx", sheet = "Sheet1", skip = 1)
Table_S6 <- read_excel("C:/Users/jacob/OneDrive/Desktop/R Studio Projects 2024/Datasets/Table_S6.xlsx", sheet = "Sheet1", skip = 1)

# Rename columns if needed
colnames(Table_S4) <- c("Literature", "Column2", "Column3", "Column4", "Column5", "Column6", 
                        "Column7", "Column8", "Column9", "GeneHancer", "Column11", "Column12", 
                        "Column13", "Column14", "ComparisonStats", "Column16", "Column17", 
                        "Column18", "Column19")  # Adjust names as needed

# Verify data
head(Table_S4)

# Updated plot examples
# Fig. S2: Enhancer size distribution
ggplot(data = Table_S4, aes(x = Column3)) +  # Replace 'Column3' with the correct column name
  geom_histogram(bins = 30, fill = "blue", color = "black") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "Enhancer Size Distribution",
       x = "Enhancer Size (bp)",
       y = "Count")


```


```{r}
# Load necessary libraries
library(readxl)
library(ggplot2)

# Load the Excel file
Table_S4 <- read_excel("C:/Users/jacob/OneDrive/Desktop/R Studio Projects 2024/Datasets/Table S4.xlsx", sheet = "Sheet1", skip = 1)

# Rename the column to make it easier to use
colnames(Table_S4)[which(colnames(Table_S4) == "length, bp...5")] <- "enhancer_length"

# Verify the column renaming
head(Table_S4)

# Fig. S3: Enhancer length distribution
ggplot(data = Table_S4, aes(x = enhancer_length)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 30, fill = "green", color = "black") +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(title = "Enhancer Length Distribution",
       x = "Enhancer Length (bp)",
       y = "Count")

```
